notesStmt.note: Textblock in simple case binding with hollow and tiny squares. Box binding converted to detached outer case. Spine splitting at joints and tears at headcap. White accretion on front board. Usage stains, finger grease in margins. Two abrasions across foredge.
Portions of a Service Book (Psalms) pasted on one of the end flyleaves.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Shulkhan arukh (Oraḥ ḥayim) שלחן ערוך (ארח חיים)

collation.p: Quires of mostly 10 leaves each, with two inner leaves being parchment.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite semi-cursive script of the 18th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown leather, blind tooled case, with clasps.
